results.title: Advertising
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Explores the structure of an advertising agency, looking at the roles of account executives, researchers, commercial artists, copywriters, photographers, production and media planners. By following the process of an advertising campaign, the skills and collaboration required within each section of an agency are highlighted.

results.title: Asian adventure
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Australian Television Network and Grainger Maynard
results.brief_description: This visually stunning documentary captures the most forbidding and exotic of Asian locations in a series of fast moving adventures. Journey through China on a month-long bicycle tour through the southern Province of Guandong, witness dragon-boat racing and the magic of Chinese National Day celebrations. In India visit the magnificent waterways and colourful houseboats of Kashmir, tour the ancient fort city of Jhodpur and travel by camel across the Great Rajasthan Desert. Witness the magnificent spectacle of the city of Jaisalmer and embark on a fascinating bike ride from the famous pink city of Jaipur to Agra and it’s breathtaking temple of love, the Taj Mahal.

results.title: Asia Wise (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Honey, Education Dept Tasmania, Asian Studies Council and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A compilation of some of the most important and informative reports from the ABC TV program Asia Wise during 1989. The stories address social, political and cultural issues. In the diverse and complex countries of Asia today it seems the only unifying forces are, paradoxically, change and tradition. Topics covered are: - Student protests in China; peasants in China; the new Cambodia; Vietnamese refugees in Hong Kong; Japanese youth; the depletion of Asian forests; Japanese tea ceremony; Yum cha.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Honey, Education Dept Tasmania, Asian Studies Council and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: As tears go by
results.creator_credit: Wong, Rover Tang and In-gear Film
results.brief_description: Wong Kar-wai describes his first feature as ‘a tragedy set in the big city, focussing on several ordinary characters in a hopeless situation’. It has also been described as ‘an idiosyncratic riff on the plot and themes of Scorsese’s Mean Streets’. Ah Wah (Andy Lau) is an enigmatic hit man who, with his offsider Fly (Jacky Cheung), is, despite himself, dragged into trouble time and time again. The arrival of his cousin (Maggie Cheung) briefly offers hope of escape from the downward spiral. The emphasis is more on atmosphere and interplay between the three characters than upon plot. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: As good as it gets [Widescreen] [Captioned]
results.creator_credit: James L. Brooks, Kristi Zea, Bridget Johnson and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Melvin (Jack Nicholson) has established a regimented lifestyle which enables him to cope with his obsessive-compulsive disorder. His routine existence is interrupted by changes in the lives of his neighbour Simon (Greg Kinnear), and his waitress Carol (Helen Hunt). Caring for Simon’s dog, and his involvement in Carol’s personal life puts him back in touch with a humanity which has been lacking in his structured life. Powerful performances from Jack Nicholson and Helen Hunt, who both won Best Actor Oscars for their efforts.

results.title: As a matter of fact: a film about abortion
results.creator_credit: Robyn Dryen, Susan Lambert, Creative Development Branch of Australian Film Commission, Womens Film Fund and Women's Health Resources Foundation
results.brief_description: A documentary about a feminist run abortion clinic. Counselling is shown to be an important part of the procedure, which is carried out using local anaesthetic and the vacuum aspiration method. We follow one woman through the termination of her pregnancy, and other women tell why they chose to have an abortion. The film ends with an animated section on the struggle for free, legalised abortion in Australia and information on what to do and where to go if you are pregnant.

results.title: Artisans of Australia
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Pamela Paddon and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A four part tape that features master stonemason George Proudmen, moulder Jack Thomas, stained glass artist Kevin Little and axemen Bill Boyd and Mark Gardner at work during conservation and restoration work on National Estate places such as Coolamine Homestead, Garrison Holy Trinity Church and the Sydney Technical College at Ultimo.

results.title: Artists and models
results.creator_credit: Frank Tashlin, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: In this satirical slapstick comedy Dean Martin plays Rick Todd, a fledging painter who has relocated to New York in search of acclaim. Eugene, Rick’s best friend and housemate also has ambitions, as a children’s writer, but his clumsy antics continuously lose them menial jobs that they land. Despite their misfortunes the impoverished pair dream of greater things, such as food, girls, money and fame. Along the way, the friends woo their luscious neighbours, comic book artist Abigail (Dorothy Malone) and her model, Bessie (Shirley MacLaine). When Abigail resigns after being asked to beef up her storylines with more blood and gore, Rick takes her job, using Eugene’s ecstatic and vivid dreams as material. Eugene dreams up the secret formula for rocket fuel, and enemy agents are soon on his tail. Several musical interludes pepper the film that is alight with sight gags, physical and madcap humour, and despite its largely formulaic approach, is one of the finest Lewis and Martin comedies made as a duo.

results.title: Artificial breeding of dairy cattle
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates artificial insemination of dairy cattle at the Aberdeen Breeding Station, N.S.W., and shows how the productive capacity of an average herd can be improved, through careful selection of bulls, handling of cattle, collection and testing of semen, including the construction of an artificial vagina, and insemination of cows. Mentions the advantages of the artificial breeding of dairy cattle.
